comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: Not 'two-wheelers' but 'Mr Wheeler's house'. Mr W Wheeler was a member of the Executive Council of Nyasaland when Sir Alfred Sharpe was appointed the first Governor in 1907. His house would be higher up the mountain than most - the higher the position you held, the higher you could build your house. No-one was allowed to build higher than Government House, of course.

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: Sharpe was Commissioner April 1906-April 1907 and Governor May 1908-April 1910
